The following shows the number of active E2 users at each level (based on users logged in over the last month).

[% my $queryText; my $rows; my $dbrow; my $str; my %styles; my $key; my $n; sub hashValueDescendingNum { $styles{$b} <=> $styles{$a}; } my $nodeId = getId($NODE); my $uid = getId($USER)||0; my $dbh = $DB->getDatabaseHandle(); return 'No database handle!' unless $dbh; # only show themes for "active" users (in this case lastseen within 1 months $queryText = "SELECT DATE_ADD(CURDATE(), INTERVAL -1 MONTH)"; $rows = $dbh->prepare($queryText) or return $rows->errstr; $rows->execute() or return $rows->errstr; my $cutoffDate = $rows->fetchrow_array(); $queryText = "SELECT setting.setting_id,setting.vars FROM setting,user WHERE setting.setting_id=user.user_id AND user.lasttime>='$cutoffDate' AND setting.vars LIKE '%level=%'"; #$str .= '

'.$queryText.'

'; $rows = $dbh->prepare($queryText) or return $rows->errstr; $rows->execute() or return $rows->errstr; while($dbrow = $rows->fetchrow_arrayref) { $$dbrow[1] =~ m/level=([0-9]+)/; if (exists($styles{$1})) { $styles{$1} = $styles{$1}+1; } else { $styles{$1} = 1; } } $str .= ''; my $ctr = 0; foreach $key (sort hashValueDescendingNum (keys(%styles))) { $ctr++; #$n = getNodeById($key+0); if ($ctr%2==0) { $str .= ''; } else { $str .= ''; } $str .= ''; } $str .= '
Level Title Number of Users
'.($key+0).' '.(getVars(getNode('level titles', 'setting'))->{($key+0)} || 0).' '.$styles{$key}.'

Feedback to [Oolong], though much of the code is ripped out of [Theme Nirvana], and [in10se] made that.

'; return $str; %]
